stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: NetTraveler Malware Identified by Financial Sector Organization
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 5 September 2014, the credential stealing malware, Net.exe (MD5: 1e8f0f1495dc1f3a1129dbfea0a24284), was identified and analyzed by a financial sector organization. The malware calls back to www.gobackto.net (103.231.184.1).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
The source identified this malware as NetTraveler. Microsoft classified it as Trojan:Win32/Neysd.A. It includes the following functions:
Credential Theft Data Exfiltration Key Logging Downloads Additional Files

This is the .dll file injected into the svchost.exe process. The malware runs svchost.exe with the parameter "-k Iron" and the mutex "SD_2014 Is Running!".
Other file Indicators:
C:\Windows\System32\Ironney.dll (injected into svchost) C:\Windows\System32\sysinfo2013.dll C:\Users\[User]\AppData\Local\Temp\dot.bat (creates registry key for "Iron" service) C:\Users\[User]\AppData\Local\Temp\123.bmp C:\Windows\System\cert2013.dat
Registry Indicators:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Iron HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Iron\Parameters

The domain www.gobackto.net resolved to IP 103.231.184.1. The following traffic was observed:
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Content-Length: 83 Content-Type: text/html Server: Microsoft-IIS/6.0 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 15:41:24 GMT
GET /fate/stay/nighgt/master/servant.asp? [truncated] HTTP/1.1 Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/x-shockwave-flash, */* Accept-Language: en-us Cache-Control: no-cache User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.0) Host: www.gobackto.net Connection: Keep-Alive
According to a third party report, the domain www.gobackto.net was also used in a NetTraveler malware campaign with Malaysian Flight MH-17 theme around 29 July 2014.
